study_plan_entry.title: Rational approaches towards materials and polymers with nanoscale order and improved properties

free_text.Learning outcomes: Introduction of new concepts towards Materials and Polymer Superstructures with nanoscale order and improved properties resulting from their nanoscale character[br/]
free_text.Content: Biomineralization[br/]Biomimetic Mineralization[br/]Non classical crystallization[br/]Porous Materials[br/]New Polymer Surfactant Structures[br/]
free_text.Keywords: Biomineralization, Biomimetic Mineralization, Non Classical Crystallization, Double Hydrophilic Block Copolymers, Porous Silica, Porous Polymers, Porous Carbon, Bottom Up Materials Synthesis, Self assembly, Organic-Inorganic hybrid structures, Hierarchical Organization[br/]
free_text.Note: The course will introduce new bottom up approaches towards advanced nanostructured materials from recent literature examples and outline possibilities for tailored/coded self assembly. Examples will be discussed from the inorganic as well as the organic materials worlds.[br/][br/]
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic knowledge in Materials Science, Chemistry and Nanotechnology, Msc in Chemistry, Mate-rials Science, Polymer Science, Physical Chemistry and related fields will be helpful[br/]
